crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert ( gid:124; sid:5; rev:2; msg:"(smtp) unknown command"; metadata: policy max-detect-ips drop, rule-type preproc; service:smtp; classtype:protocol-command-decode;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: SURICATA SMTP Mime encoded line len exceeded
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert smtp any any -> any any (msg:"SURICATA SMTP Mime encoded line len exceeded"; flow:established; app-layer-event:smtp.mime_long_enc_line; flowint:smtp.anomaly.count,+,1; classtype:protocol-command-decode; sid:2220016; rev:1;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: SURICATA Applayer Detect protocol only one direction
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert ip any any -> any any (msg:"SURICATA Applayer Detect protocol only one direction"; flow:established; app-layer-event:applayer_detect_protocol_only_one_direction; flowint:applayer.anomaly.count,+,1; classtype:protocol-command-decode; sid:2260002; rev:1;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: TGI HUNT b64 exe in TCP (UTF8)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tcp any any -> any any (msg:"TGI HUNT b64 exe in TCP (UTF8)"; flow:established; content:"TVqQAAMAAAAEAAAA//8AAL"; fast_pattern; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2610776; rev:1;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: File Found over SMTP and stored
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert smtp any any -> any any (msg:"File Found over SMTP and stored"; filestore; sid:27; rev:1;)

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered worm. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

attributes.magic: PE32 executable (GUI) Intel 80386, for MS Windows, UPX compressed

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the execution of a Windows system binary that is usually located in the system folder from an uncommon location.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Patrick Bareiss, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=16D1DFAB13D546B4611DDB570EE5102C,SHA256=6A9C46D96F001A1A3CC47D166D6C0AABC26A5CF25610CEF51D2B834526C6B596,IMPHASH=00000000000000000000000000000000; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\Explorer.EXE; CommandLine="C:\Windows\lsass.exe" ; ParentImage=C:\Windows\explorer.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\lsass.exe}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over an un-encrypted network protocol other than that of the existing command and control channel.
The data may also be sent to an alternate network location from the main command and control server.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Files With System Process Name In Unsuspected Locations
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects the creation of an executable with a system process name in folders other than the system ones (System32, SysWOW64, etc.).
It is highly recommended to perform an initial baseline before using this rule in production.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Sander Wiebing, Tim Shelton, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detect suspicious parent processes of well-known Windows processes

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=16D1DFAB13D546B4611DDB570EE5102C,SHA256=6A9C46D96F001A1A3CC47D166D6C0AABC26A5CF25610CEF51D2B834526C6B596,IMPHASH=00000000000000000000000000000000; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\Explorer.EXE; CommandLine="C:\Windows\lsass.exe" ; ParentImage=C:\Windows\explorer.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\lsass.exe}

packers.PEiD: UPX 2.90 [LZMA] -> Markus Oberhumer, Laszlo Molnar & John Reiser

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: This sample is a mass-mailing and P2P worm. It establishes persistence by creating a registry key under 'Software\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\Run' with the value name 'Traybar'. The malware spreads by copying itself to directories related to file-sharing applications (e.g., 'download', 'shar', 'incoming') and by harvesting email addresses from the Windows Address Book (WAB) to send itself as an attachment. Additionally, it attempts to masquerade as a legitimate system process by copying itself to the Windows or Temp directory as 'lsass.exe'. It also creates a mutex based on the system's hostname to ensure only one instance is running.
